data.title: Nice small town pedestrian area
data.text: State Street is the center of this friendly small town.  There's the Falconer English pub just around the corner at the bottom end, and one of the original Cuca's at the top.  Branch right for A La Minute ice cream made with liquid Nitrogen. Branch right for Augie's award winning coffee.  Go straight to enjoy the huge shade trees, art and nicknack stores, Gourmet pizza etc. etc.  Market Night is Thursdays, when they close off several streets to keep all the teenagers safe.

data.title: Parking Problem and Riff Raff
data.text:
Difficult to park near the nice parts of downtown between 11am-7pm.
And you can forget about that Market Night!  ugh

data.title: A community on the rise!
data.text: Be sure to head downtown on Thursday evening for the market festival, 6-9 PM.  Streets closed off, vendors and local farmers - including certified organic all set up and ready to serve you.  Lots of fun for all ages and tons of local color and music.

data.title: This is a quaint piece of California history
data.text: The city of Redlands has a deep and abiding a sense of civic pride. The downtown area is constantly improving and taking care of infrastructure issues to make this place better for everyone. There are dozens of wonderful shops that are homegrown. The Thursday night farmers market is a hidden treasure of the inland Empire. The one negative is the mall area that they have built near downtown off of State Street. There are many undesirable people that hang out there. I have never encountered the same undesirables while walking down the street in "old downtown." Redlands is a delightful place and it should keep the urbanization outside…

data.title: Thursday evening farmer's market
data.text: We noticed a very fun-looking Farmer's Market being setup for a 6pm start, but after a cloudburst when we returned it was *all gone*?!  Not sure why they didn't just ride out the storm; everyone had popups and there is plenty of building overhang and shelter.  Anyway, if you're visiting on a Thursday night it looks to be a terrific way to spend it.

data.title: Cute Downtown Area
data.text: Downtown Redlands still has some of the charm missing in many other places, although the recession has taken it's toll. State St. is shaded by a dense umbrella of trees extending several blocks. Nice walking territory. Some highlights: a big antique/collectibles emporium, comic book shop, Baskin Robbins. On Orange St, not far away, Trader Joe's. Just a pleasant place to take in small town atmosphere.

data.title: Many Shops & Restaurants
data.text: We went to 2 restaurants and in several shops. I would like to see the shops have similar hours of operation. Many were when we went in the morning, then when we returned in the evening they were open, and the ones who are open in the morning were closed.

data.title: If you want...
data.text: The City center is good but if you want to have fun shopping then go to Down town Redlands on state street. This place is historic and beautiful from the original Brick buildings to the small town feel you will love it! Take it from me i live here
